articles.description: Stuart Broad ends his glittering career by bowling England to another dramatic victory in the fifth Test against Australia to leave a memorable Ashes series level at 2-2.
articles.title: Broad bowls England to series-levelling win

articles.description: England win an incredible fifth Test to level the Ashes series at 2-2 as Stuart Broad takes the final two wickets in a fairytale ending to his cricket career at The Oval.
articles.title: England win after fairytale Broad ending

articles.description: Stuart Broad says he will leave cricket with "pure joy and happiness" after taking the final two wickets as England drew the Ashes with a 49-run victory.
articles.title: 'Pure joy and happiness' - Broad on fairytale finale

articles.description: Brazil midfielder Fabinho completes a move to Saudi Arabian club Al-Ittihad from Liverpool on a three-year deal.
articles.title: Fabinho makes move to Al-Ittihad from Liverpool

articles.description: England come through a physical test to beat Tonga 72-46 and start the second pool phase of the Netball World Cup with an improved display.
articles.title: England beat Tonga with improved display

articles.description: Stuart Broad switches the bails at the bowler's end and immediately has Todd Murphy caught behind on a thrilling day five of the fifth Ashes Test at The Oval.
articles.title: Broad switches bails again before removing Murphy

articles.description: Sarina Wiegman says England are "strong enough" to navigate their way through the Women's World Cup despite losing midfielder Keira Walsh.
articles.title: Lionesses 'strong enough' without Walsh at World Cup

articles.description: Australia captain Pat Cummins says his side "fell a little short of the goal" despite being proud of his players for retaining the Ashes.
articles.title: Australia fell short of Ashes goal - Cummins

articles.description: Manchester United defender Luke Shaw accepts the Treble-winning feats of Manchester City hurt everyone at Old Trafford - and they cannot afford to let it happen again.
articles.title: Man City Treble 'hurt a lot' - Man Utd's Shaw

articles.description: By beating Canada 4-0 and qualifying for the last 16, it feels like Australia have finally arrived at their own party.
articles.title: Australia avert 'disaster' to join World Cup party
